intro: Androsace henryi, commonly known as the Henry's Androsace, is a low-growing alpine plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth habit. The plant features small, often hairy leaves and produces clusters of delicate, five-petaled flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in specialized gardens.
